description: Variation of condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission P/2024/0595 & P/2024/0610 approved 06/06/2024 for the demolition of an existing shed, oil tank and part of the existing wall for a new learning hub. Erection of a new building as the volunteer base. Creation of new Fruit Garden, erection of a storage shed with hardstanding, alteration of part of the brick walls with new accesses to the Fruit Garden and Kitchen Garden. Erection of a new canopy for the Stables and its change of use to Artist Studios, installation of new signage, reconfiguration of the staff car park, and internal works to buildings including new roof insulation, heating and power. Listed Building Consent - P/2024/3997
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from 06/06/2024 when P/2024/0595 was approved.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [221a-AD 2110, 221a-AD 2111, 221a-AD 2120, 221a-AD 3110, 221a-AD 3111, 221a-AD 4110, 221a-AD 5110, 221a-AD 5111, 221a-AD 5112, 221a-GA 1230X, 221a-GA 2110P, 221a-GA 2210X, 221a-GA 2240P, 221a-GA 2312P, 221a-GA 3110P, 221a-GA 3130X, 221a-GA 3140P, 221a-GA 3210P, 221a-GA 3210X, 221a-GA 3211P, 221a-GA 3211X, 221a-GA 3220P, 221a-GA 3221P, 221a-GA 3230P, 221a-GA 3231P, 221a-GA 3240P, 221a-GA 4221P, 221a-GA 4230P, 221a-GA 4240P, 221a-GA 5230X, 221a-GA 5240X, 221a-GA 5310P, 221a-GA 5330X, 221a-GA 5340P, 221a-GA 5340X, 221a-GA 5410P, 221a-GA 5430X, 221a-GA 5440P, 221a-GA 5440X, Design and Access Statement, Planning Fire Safety Strategy, Urban Greening Factor calculation, Ground Investigation Proposal, Schedule of Condition of Chiswick House Grounds, Biodiversity Survey Report, Energy Statement 20647-QODA-XX-XX-RP-YS-1001, Heritage Statement & Impact Assessment, 221a-GA 3110P with drainage note and 221-GA 4120P with drainage note; Received: 27/2/2024; 221a-GA 2130X, 221a-GA 4130X, 221a-GA 4210X, 221a-GA 4211X and 221a-GA 5130X; Received: 7/3/2024; Surface & Foul Water Drainage Technical Note 1747-R01 13.05.24; Received: 17/5/2024; Cedar Yards Archaeological Desk-Based Assessment; Received: 24/5/2024; CY-VB-240-S73, CY-VB-241-S73, CY-VB-250-S73, CY-VB-251-S73, CY-VB-252-S73, CY-VB-253-S73, CY-LH-210-S73, CY-LH-211-S73, CY-LH-240-S73, CY-LH-242-S73, CY-LH-243-S73,CY-LH-244-S73, CY-LH-250-S73, CY-LH-251-S73, Cover letter dated 19th November 2024 and Planning Note - Section 73. Received: 19/11/2024; CY-010-S73.R, CY-011-S73.R, CY-050-S73.R, CY-LH-201-S73.R, CY-CC-ST-200-S73.R, CY-CC-200-S73.R, CY-VB-200-S73.R and CY-VB-201-S73.R. Received: 04/12/2024; CY-LH-240-S73.R and CY-LH-241-S73.R. Received: 13/12/2024; Learning Hub BRUKL Output Document. Received: 16/01/2025]. 
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning p
Condition : 3 - Development of Phase 1a shall be carried out in strict accordance with the external material details approved on 23/01/2025 under planning reference P/2024/3978.

No development above ground level shall take place for the other phases until full details and samples of all materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Details must include a detailed schedule of materials, a photographic sample board and rendered drawings, elevations and sections at a sufficient scale (1:20 or 1:50) to illustrate how all external materials will appear together.

The samples/details shall include: 

(a)         Brick/stonework (including brick, stone, masonry, brick panels, feature brick panel, brick framing feature and mortar on-site sample panel, minimum one metre by one metre) including all mortar colours, joint type, brick bond;
(b)         Cladding materials / render (including specifications where relevant);
(c)          Tiles / roof covering; including parapet coping / capping materials, dormers and canopies;
(d)         Window types; and sectional drawings of reveals / sills / head details 
(e)         Any other materials/details / fittings to be used (including solar panels, extract vents, rainwater goods, boiler flues etc.), with sections and on-site samples where appropriate
(f)          Balustrading treatment (including details / sections / materials); and
(g)         Any other materials / details / fittings to be used (including solar panels, extract vents, boiler flues etc.), with sections and on-site samples where appropriate

The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.

Reason: In order to protect the appearance of the area
Condition : 4 - The office floorspace hereby approved shall be used only as offices ancillary to the main use of the premises to support the cultural, community and educational uses of Chiswick House and Grounds and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure no independent office use and the primary use of the premises is for Chiswick House and Grounds.
Condition : 5 - The storage area hereby permitted shall be used only to store ancillary for Chiswick House and Grounds and not other purpose (including any purpose in Class B8 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 or any order revoking or re-enacting that order).
 
Reason: To ensure the use is carried out in accordance with the permissions hereby given and adequate storage space for the use.
Condition : 6 - Prior to operational commencement of the Fruit Garden, a management plan detailing its operation hours, frequency of functions, number of attendees, crowd control measures, noise control measures be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason: To protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers and in the interest of traffic safety and parking.
Condition : 7 - The affordable workspaces in the Creative Campus hereby approved 
a)	shall be used only for creative/ light industry and not be used for any other purpose.
b)	Prior to operational commencement, a management plan detailing the rent of the affordable workspace (including comparison to market level), operation hours, number of artists and noise control measures be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason: To support the cultural and creative industry in the borough and protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers.
Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding any details included in the submitted plans, no development above ground level (except any demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation work) shall take place until details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include: 
(a)	a statement setting out the design objectives and how these will be delivered; 
(b)	existing and proposed finished levels or contours; 
(c)	means of enclosure/boundary treatments and retaining structures;
(d)	vehicle parking layouts; 
(e)	other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas;
(f)	hard surfacing materials; 
(g)	minor artefacts and structures (e.g. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting, CCTV etc.); 
(h)	proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (e.g. drainage, power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating alignments, levels, access points, supports as relevant); 
(i)	retained historic or other landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant; 
(j)	renewable energy installations (where relevant);
(k)	planting plans which includes replacement trees of Turkey oak T2, mature sycamore T7 and off-site mature
oak tree T12 if they are felled, written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers and densities where appropriate; and
(l)	an implementation programme (including phasing of work where relevant).

The landscaping works shall comply with the requirements specified in BS 3936 (1992) 'Specification of Nursery Stock Part 1 Trees and Shrubs', and in BS 4428 (1989) 'Recommendations for General Landscape Operations', and shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, or such other
Condition : 9 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the Construction Logistics Plan approved on 12/12/2024 under planning reference P/2024/3680.
Reason: In order to ensure highway safety is maintained and preserved and to safeguard the amenities of adjoining residential properties.
Condition : 10 - Notwithstanding the submitted details and prior to occupation, full details (including manufacturer's specifications) of all cycle stands for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before any part of the development is first occupied and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Parking Management Plan shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to secure any variation. 
Reason: In order to control the level and usage of parking on the site and to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 12 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
Reason: In the interests of the safety of pedestrians and vehicles, to protect neighbours' living conditions and to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 13 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Travel Plan in accordance with current Council and TfL guidance comprising immediate, continuing and long-term measures to promote and encourage a reduction in car use, for visitors, staff, and volunteers shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented upon occupation, and thereafter monitored and reviewed in accordance with the agreed Travel Plan targets and timescales to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives, including a reduction in single occupancy car journeys and the increased use of public transport, walking and cycling.
Condition : 14 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and Learning Hub BRUKL Output Document.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved zero carbon in emissions. If zero carbon cannot be achieved, the applicant shall enter into a binding arrangement with the Council to make an agreed contribution to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved to an amount that equates to the shortfall in required energy savings to meet the 'zero carbon' target.
Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.
Condition : 15 - Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant must submit a final detailed drainage design including drawings and supporting calculations and updated Drainage Assessment Form to the Lead Local Flood Authority for review and approval, aligned with the Surface & Foul Water Drainage Technical Note (13/05/2024) and associated drawings. The results of infiltration testing to BRE365 should be provided to confirm a suitable infiltration rate, and the calculations should confirm that there is sufficient capacity provided in the new and existing soakaways to manage the additional surface water runoff. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to London Plan Policy SI 13, its associated Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems and Hounslow Council's Local Plan Policy EQ3.
Condition : 16 - No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Reason: To comply with the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems, the National Planning Policy Framework (Paragraph 103), the London Plan (Policies SI 12 and SI 13) along with associated guidance to these policies and Hounslow Council's Local Plan Policy EQ3.
Condition : 17 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the contamination information approved on 14/01/2025 under planning reference P/2024/3898.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety. 
Condition : 18 - Land quality - intrusive site investigation
Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:
Following the completion of the Phase I desk study report, if intrusive investigations or gas monitoring is recommended, a Phase II site investigation must be undertaken.
No development other than necessary works to enable intrusive investigations shall take place until a Phase II site investigation report, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
This report shall identify the areas and sources of land contamination that exist on the site and identify the scope of site remediation measures necessary before the development commences.
The investigation shall be carried out by a competent person(s), based on the initial Conceptual Site Model (CSM) and on-site observations, to identify the extent and nature of contaminants. The initial CSM shall be updated accordingly following a tiered risk assessment based on the findings of the investigation, and where applicable, the report shall include proposals to deal with the identified contamination on site.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting Notes:
(i)	The report shall include details of such sampling of soil, soil vapour, ground gas, leachate, surface water and/or groundwater at such locations and depths as are considered to characterise the site conditions based on the initial Conceptual Site Model (CSM) and on-site observations during investigation work. 
(ii)	The investigation and the report must adhere to current UK guidance and best practice.
(iii)	Further investigation shall be carried out at such locations and at such depths as the local planning authority may stipulate if this report  is found to be i
Condition : 19 - Land quality � Remediation Method Statement/ Remediation Strategy
Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:
If a scheme for remediation is recommended in the Phase II site investigation for the site, no development shall take place until a remediation method statement prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person to specify the works necessary to render the site suitable for its proposed end use, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting Notes:
(i)	The remediation method statement shall provide suitable details of how the risks of each pollutant linkages, as identified in the updated Conceptual Site Model, will be mitigated.
(ii)	The report shall account for any comments made by the local planning authority. 
(iii)	Remediation work shall be carried out in accordance with the approved remediation method statement for verification and validation before the development is first brought into use.
(iv)	The Council requests that remediation method statement or site plans be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.
Condition : 20 - Land quality � additional/unexpected contamination found during development
During the development:
The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if any land contamination not previously identified is encountered during development. A competent person shall assess the contamination, where necessary, including soil and groundwater sampling and testing before any further part of the development that may be affected by the additional contamination that has been discovered continues.
A revised remediation method statement, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval within one month of the discovery of such contamination.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i)	Further remediation work to remove or manage additional contamination shall be carried out in accordance with the approved revised remediation method statement for verification and validation before the development is first brought into use. 
(ii)	In some instances, the local planning authority may require work on site to be ceased whilst the nature of additional contamination is investigated fully.
(iii)	The Council requests that the revised remediation method statement or any site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.
Condition : 21 - Land quality - verification and validation of remedial work
Prior to the development is first brought into use:
The agreed scheme for remediation, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented. A verification report produced upon completion of the remediation by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval, before the development is first brought into use or in accordance with a programme approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i)	The verification (closure) report shall revisit the conceptual site model and provide evidence that each aspect of the remediation plan has been implemented correctly and successfully in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice. Where applicable, the report shall describe how any additional/unexpected contamination encountered during development has been managed in line with the revised remediation method statement. 
(ii)	This report shall demonstrate that the development is suitable for its proposed use in terms of land quality.
(iii)	The Council requests that the verification report or site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.
Condition : 22 - Land quality - long term monitoring and maintenance
If long term monitoring and maintenance is required following successful completion of approved remedial measures, reports which demonstrate the effectiveness of the monitoring and maintenance shall be prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person and submitted to the local planning authority according to an agreed timescale as shall first have been approved under other conditions set out in this planning approval decision notice.
This shall be conducted in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice.
Reason: In order to ensure that risks from land contamination to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised, together with those to controlled waters, properties and ecological systems.
Condition : 23 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the Written scheme of investigation approved on 14/01/2025 under planning reference P/2024/3898.
Reason: To safeguard the archaeological interest on this site
Condition : 24 - a) The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which this permission refers, shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the plant operate. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or one metre from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142. An alternative position for assessment/measurement may be used to allow ease of access, this must be shown on a map and noise propagation calculations detailed to show how the design criteria are achieved. 

b) The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter.   

c) Following installation of any mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014 (Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments. The post completion report shall be both completed and submitted to the local authority within 28 days of completion of the installation for review. If the plant fails to meet the specified standard, remedial measures shall be put in place immediately and the noise assessment shall be carried out again.  This shall be repeated until the assessment has reached the required standard.  Once achieved, the plant shall be maintained permanently ther
